Nonforfeiture Benefit.value: Contingent Benefit Upon Lapse: Provides full MBA and a reduced TBA equal to the greater of total amount of premium paid or 1x MBA if policy ends due to non-payment or cancellation after substantial premium increase. Optional Nonforfeiture Rider: must be in effect for 3 years and when policy ends; provides full MBA and reduced TBA equal to greater of total premium paid or 1x MBA (available at initial application only).

sources.snippet: Limited coverage if policy ends due to non-payment of premiums or insured's written request to cancel, following a substantial premium increase (defined by NAIC guidelines). Provides full MBA and a reduced TBA equal to the greater of total amount of premium paid or 1x MBA.

Nonforfeiture Rider: Provides some benefits if policy lapses for nonpayment of premiums ... Rider must be in effect for 3 years and be in effect when the policy ends; Provides full MBA and a reduced TBA equal to the greater of: the total amount of premium paid; or 1x MBA; Available at initial application only

Compound Inflation.value: Automatic Compound Inflation Protection Riders: increases MBA and remaining portion of TBA at end of previous policy year by either 3% or 5% (no corresponding increase in premium).

Survivorship.value: Shared Care Rider: when insured dies, remaining TBA under his/her policy is transferred to the spouse's/partner's policy at no extra cost; insured and spouse/partner can access benefits under each other's policy once TBA under their own policy is exhausted.

sources.snippet: Shared Care Rider: Insured and spouse/partner can access benefits under each other's policy once the TBA under their own policy is exhausted; When insured dies, remaining TBA under his/her policy is transferred to the spouse's/partner's policy at no extra cost; Rider available at any time, subject to underwriting; Both spouse/partners must have identical policies

Guaranteed Purchase Option.value: GPO: Insured able to purchase additional coverage every 3 years, up to age 65, with no additional underwriting; premium for increase is at attained age rates; lifetime maximum increase available is 2x initial TBA and 2x initial MBA; minimum 25% of initial coverage must be purchased each time; 10 Year Premium Payment Rider not available with GPO.

sources.snippet: GUARANTEED PURCHASE OPTION (GPO): Insured able to purchase additional coverage every 3 years, up to age 65, with no additional underwriting; Premium for increase in coverage is at attained age rates; Lifetime maximum increase available is 2x initial TBA and 2x initial MBA; Minimum of 25% of initial coverage must be purchased each time GPO is exercised; 10 Year Premium Payment Rider is not available with GPO.

Indemnity Benefit.value: Cash Benefit Rider: Full MBA paid as cash payment (regardless of actual charges incurred) instead of reimbursement for covered services; available at initial application only; $1MM TBA not available with this rider; benefits paid over annual IRC limit may be taxable.

sources.snippet: Cash Benefit Rider: Full MBA paid as cash payment (regardless of actual charges incurred) instead of reimbursement for covered services; Available at initial application only; $1MM TBA not available; Benefits paid over annual IRC limit may be taxable

Renewal Premium.value: Premium for increase in coverage under GPO is at attained age rates.

sources.snippet: Premium for increase in coverage is at attained age rates;

Cancellation.value: Free Look: Insured has 30 days to review policy and return for a full refund. Policy may end due to non-payment of premiums; contingent benefit upon lapse provisions apply following substantial premium increases or cancellation.

CASH_BENEFIT_RIDER.snippet: Cash Benefit Rider: Full MBA paid as cash payment (regardless of actual charges incurred) instead of reimbursement for covered services; Available at initial application only; $1MM TBA not available; Benefits paid over annual IRC limit may be taxable

reasoningNotes: Populated only fields that have explicit evidence in the extraction JSON (plan type, MBA/TBA options, elimination period, home/community/facility care, bed reservation, return of premium, international benefit, care coordination, premium waiver, payment options, benefit increase options, GPO, cash benefit rider, contingent benefit upon lapse, initial needs assessment).
Where multiple related lines of evidence exist (e.g., contingent nonforfeiture benefit and optional nonforfeiture rider), values were combined and confidence reflects the aggregated evidence.

Fields related to specific ADL triggers and many granular items (Ambulating, Bathing, Toileting, Transferring, DME amounts/days, respite, equipment rental, home modifications, etc.) are not present in the extraction and were left null per instruction not to fabricate data.

Simple vs. Compound inflation mapping: FPO (5% increase) mapped to Simple Inflation and the 'Automatic Compound Inflation Protection Riders' mapped to Compound Inflation. Confidence for these is lower (0.4) because the extraction grouped benefit increase options and indicated availability differences (Custom Advantage only) with lower extraction confidence.
For 'Days or Dollar Based' and 'EP Calendar or Service Days' fields, the presence of '100 Calendar Days' allowed a calendar/days determination with high confidence.
Two 'Additional Benefits' slots were used to capture Bed Reservation and International Benefit as notable extra benefits referenced in the document.
